insight: Only 25% of senior roles in financial services are held by women, and less than 5% of S&P 500 companies have female CEOs. There is a powerful cultural tension around gender equality in business.
single_minded_proposition: One small statue can start a movement for change in corporate boardrooms.
strategy: Rather than running traditional advertising about gender diversity, create a physical symbol of female empowerment placed directly in front of Wall Street's Charging Bull. Let culture and earned media do the work.
creative_idea: A 4-foot bronze statue of a young girl defiantly facing down the Charging Bull on Wall Street, installed on International Women's Day.
why_it_won: Combined a powerful cultural insight with a single bold action. No media buy needed - earned $7.4 billion in free media. Drove 384% increase in traffic to SHE fund. Proof that a single-minded idea with cultural tension creates fame.
effectiveness_notes: The campaign generated massive earned media, social engagement, and real business results. It demonstrated the IPA principle that emotional, fame-driving campaigns massively outperform rational ones.

insight: People assume suicidal people look visibly distressed. In reality, 3 out of 4 people who die by suicide show no obvious signs. This misconception prevents people from checking in on loved ones.
single_minded_proposition: Suicide doesn't always look like suicide. The biggest clue can be no clue at all.
strategy: Challenge the assumption that suicidal people are easy to spot. Use real last photos of real people who died by suicide - photos in which they look happy - to shatter the myth and drive behaviour change.
creative_idea: A gallery of joyful, ordinary 'last photos' of real people before they took their own lives. Each photo looked perfectly normal - that was the entire point.
why_it_won: A devastating reframe of an assumption. Single-minded to the extreme. The gap between what you see (happy photos) and what happened (suicide) is the entire creative tension. Drives a clear desired response: check in on people even when they seem fine.
effectiveness_notes: Calls to CALM's helpline increased 30%. Demonstrated that the most powerful briefs start with a single human truth that reframes how people see the world.

insight: Every ad on TV features clean clothes. People never notice because it's invisible. Tide is hiding in plain sight in every commercial ever made.
single_minded_proposition: Every ad is a Tide ad because every ad features clean clothes.
strategy: Own the Super Bowl by hijacking every other ad genre. If every ad features clean clothes, every ad is secretly a Tide ad. Turn competitors' conventions against them.
creative_idea: A series of Super Bowl ads that spoof other ad genres (car, beer, perfume, etc.), revealing each time that 'it's actually a Tide ad' because the clothes are clean.
why_it_won: Brilliantly single-minded. One insight, one idea, executed across every possible genre. It reframed the entire Super Bowl ad break as Tide content. Classic example of the Creative Ladder - taking a mundane product truth and making it famous.
effectiveness_notes: Most talked-about Super Bowl advertiser. 164K mentions in first 6 hours. Proved that a single-minded proposition executed with creativity generates outsized returns.

insight: Only 4% of women around the world consider themselves beautiful. Women are their own worst critics when it comes to their appearance.
single_minded_proposition: You are more beautiful than you think.
strategy: Prove to women that their self-perception is distorted by having an FBI-trained sketch artist draw them twice: once based on their own description, once based on a stranger's description. The gap between the two reveals the truth.
creative_idea: An FBI-trained forensic artist draws women based on their own description vs. a stranger's. The stranger's sketch is always more beautiful, proving women underestimate their own beauty.
why_it_won: Universal insight, simple execution, deeply emotional. The single-minded proposition 'you are more beautiful than you think' was proven through an experiment rather than stated in a headline. Emotion over information.
effectiveness_notes: Most watched online ad ever at launch (114M views in first month). Drove measurable uplift in brand preference. IPA evidence: emotional campaigns that achieve fame deliver the strongest long-term business effects.

insight: Burger King's biggest rival has 14,000 more locations. People pass a McDonald's far more often than a BK. Instead of fighting this disadvantage, weaponise it.
single_minded_proposition: Turn every McDonald's into a Burger King ordering point.
strategy: Use geofencing technology to offer a 1-cent Whopper to anyone who orders through the BK app while within 600 feet of a McDonald's. Turn the competitor's biggest advantage (location density) into a BK customer acquisition tool.
creative_idea: Order a 1-cent Whopper from the BK app - but only when you're standing inside or next to a McDonald's. The app redirects you to the nearest Burger King.
why_it_won: A single-minded idea that turned a competitive weakness into a strength. Bold, cheeky, and measurably effective. The strategy and creative were inseparable - a hallmark of Cannes-winning work.
effectiveness_notes: 1.5M app downloads in 9 days. BK app went from #686 to #1 in App Store. 37:1 return on investment. Demonstrates that sharp strategic thinking combined with bold creative execution drives outsized results.

insight: The British Museum's collection includes thousands of contested artefacts taken from colonised nations. The museum presents them with sanitised plaques that omit their violent origins.
single_minded_proposition: The stories the British Museum won't tell you, told inside the British Museum itself.
strategy: Create an unofficial audio-visual tour inside the British Museum using AR and podcast technology that tells the unfiltered, contested history of 10 stolen artefacts - accessible only when standing in front of each object.
creative_idea: An Instagram AR filter and podcast series that reveals the true colonial history of contested artefacts, geo-triggered inside the British Museum.
why_it_won: Subversive, culturally urgent, and technically innovative. A single-minded reframe: the same objects, radically different stories. The desired response is crystal clear - see these artefacts differently. Challenge an institution by working inside it.
effectiveness_notes: 8M+ podcast downloads. Demonstrated that the best briefs identify a powerful tension and give creative teams permission to be genuinely provocative.
